intro: Oxyceros fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered oxyceros, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
